full_text:
Gosu for Integration

Lesson
objectives ¢ Describe the general capabilities of a Gosu

class and its properties
* Describe common Gosu features used for
integration, such as:
+ Logging
+ Exception handling
+ Annotations

+ Sequence utility

i Packages

* Packages organize related artifacts in a hierarchy
¢ Classes, Enhancements and other files
¢ All packages reside under .../configuration/gsrc folder
* Guidewire recommends the following naming conventions:

« <company_code>.<product_code>.mechanism.<functional_area>

+ Examples v Di gsre
* si.ta.classes.utilities > BB com.guidewire.pl
> gw
* si.ta.enhancements.entity > Bai libraries
* Class/file names must be unique within v Bil classes
the package v Bil entity
© AsBContactSummary
utilities

enhancements.entity

i Access modifier keywords Ga

« Use access modifier keywords to set the level of access to a top-level type (class,
interface, enumeration), or a type member (method, variable, or property)

ue, Description Applies to | Appliesto | Visiblein | Visiblein | Visible in | Visible Gosu default for
top-level | type class package subclass | byall
— types members

public Fully accessible Yes Top-level types
Method
Property
protected Accessible only by types with - Yes Yes Yes Yes -
same package and subtypes
internal Accessible only in same Yes Yes Yes Yes - ~ =
package
private Accessible only by declaring - Yes Yes - - - Variable

type that defines it

i Other modifier keywords G

Other Description

Modifier

keyword

Override Apply the override modifier to a method or property override function myMethod(
implementation to declare that the subtype overrides the myParameter : String )

implementation of an inherited method or property with the
same signature.

Abstract Indicates that a type is intended only to be a base type of other —_ abstract class Vehicle {
types. }
Final Specifies that the value of a property, local variable, or class exampleABC {

parameter cannot be modified after the initial value is assigned. _ final var_name : String = "John”}
The final modifier cannot be combined with the abstract
modifier on anything.

Static Gosu classes can define a variable stored once per Gosu class, private static var _name : String
rather than once per instance of the class. This modifier can also
be used with properties and methods. If a class variable is static,
it is referred to as a static variable.

i Gosu classes

¢ AGosu class (.gs file) describes an object properties and behaviors ©
* Gosu classes are similar to classes in other object-oriented languages

* To create a class, use the class keyword, followed by the class name, and then

define its constructor, variables, properties, and methods

« Meaningful name with Pascal case
(First letter of each word is capitalized)

* Optionally include access modifier as required/desired

¢ Non-static classes are instantiated using the new keyword

Access is public by default

Pass any constructor arguments in parentheses

Gi

© MySampleClass.gs x
1 package si.ta.classes

{

class Mys

construct () {
}

eIKVHewoN

}

® Gosu Scratchpad x

ae
1 uses si.ta.classes.MySampleClass
2 var myInstance = new MySampleClass ()

i Extending a class Gi

@©squere.gs x
class Square extends Rectangle implements ILineAndFill {

9 construct () {

super ()
9 4}

Access to
inherited
properties

aa return (4 * Width)
42, }

The subclass can access to all non-private properties and methods declared in the
superclass

i Gosu methods

* Declare a method using the function
keyword

* Methods describe object behavior and
features

* Optionally include access modifier as
required/desired

+ Access is public by default
« Method name in Camel Case

* Optionally describe parameters and return type
(String, int, etc)

* The this keyword refers to the instance of
the class from which the method is called

| @©pectangle.os x |

2

39

package acme.ta.classes

class Rectangle {

function calculateArea(): int {
return (width * height)
}

function addToWidth(valueToAdd: int): void {
this. width = this. width + valueToAdd
}

* The block | | Block part | Description

consists of four 1 \ Identifies that the following is a block

parts: 2 elementname A name representing each element of the array
3 > Identifies the start of the condition
4 condition A condition, which relates to the element

Declaring Gosu properties

¢ Approach 1: Define getter and
setter methods

¢ Best practice has variable names begin
with an underscore “_”

¢ Approach 2: Use shorthand syntax
e Use as keyword

* Getter and setter are automatically
created for you

* They do not appear in the class

¢ Both approaches are essentially
equivalent, but developerhas more

control with the first approach ===>

=:

class UserPreferen

//1) Bepreach
var _heightInleters : BigDecimal

return (this. heightInMeters / 0.0254) .round (MathContext.DECIMAL32) as double
} else {
return 0.0

(height: BigDecimal) {

if (this. heightInMeters != null) {
this. heightInMeters = (height * 0.0254) as double
} else {
this. heightInMeters = 0

//// epecach 2: Use syntax ////
var weight : BigDecimal as Weight

| Property initialization G

Gosu enables a standard compact syntax for property initialization during object
creation

« For example, suppose you have the following Gosu code:

uses trainingapp.classes.Rectangle

var myRectangle = new Rectangle()
myRectangle.Height = 5
myRectangle.Width = 7
myRectangle.Label = "Rectangle Area”

« You can optionally use Gosu object initializers to simplify this code:

uses trainingapp.classes.Rectangle

var myRectangle = new Rectangle() {
iHeight = 5,
:Width = 7,
tLabel = "Rectangle Area"

}

i Feature literals for property reference Gi

* Statically refer to the features of a given type in the Gosu type system with feature
literals

¢ Various kinds of feature references

« Syntax: type#Feature

« Property: ABContact#Address When it

* Method: ABContact#addContactNote needs to be
+ Uses type safe,

¢ Bind argument values in method reference use feature

* Supports chaining literals!

i Logging

>

4 44

“1

package trainingapp.classes [5

uses gw.api.system.PLLoggerCategory
uses gw.api.util.DisplayableException
uses org.sif4).Logger

class Rectangle {
construct () {
}
protected var logger : Logger= PLLoggerCategory. CO!

function enlarge(factor: int): String {
if (factor <= 0) {
logger. info("Rectangel.enlarge() invalid factor " + factor)
throw new DisplayableException ("Requires a factor greater than 0")
)

Uses the slf4j API, in conjunction with Apache log4j-2 libraries and internal Guidewire libraries

+ Itis possible for both internal Guidewire code or custom integration code to define additional logging
categories that do not show in the logging configuration file

+ Itis also possible for third-party components, such as Apache, to provide their own logging categories

* Each Guidewire application has its own unique categories as well

i Exception handling

* Gosu supports the full feature set for Java
exception handling, including try/catch/finally

5 * function hendleAnExceptionExemple(parml : int) (

i Annotation support = G

package trainingapp.classes

uses...

1 class Rectangle {

Gosu annotations are a simple syntax to provide metadata or behavior to a class,
constructor, method, or property

+ Use the @ symbol followed by the annotation name
* Often, an argument list within parentheses follows an annotation

i Sequence utility

¢ A Guidewire class that is used to generate unique, sequential numbers
¢ Useful for business cases requiring numbers that are sequential or unique

* Guidewire database stores sequence information
* For each sequence, it maintains a record of the last number provided

* The database provides the next number in the given sequence

i Sequence utility syntax G

gw.api.system.database.SequenceUtil.next(minVal, seqKey)
* next method is used to request numbers
* minVal is the minimum value for the first number in the sequence
* seqKey is a unique name for the sequence
© sequenceUtiltyExamples.gs

package trainingapp.demo.gosu
uses gw.api.system.database.SequenceUtil

class SequenceUtilityE

public static function print Numbers (seqString : String) : void {
var firstNum = SequenceUtil.next(1, seqString)
print (seqString + "-" + firstNum)
var nextNum = SequenceUtil.next(1, seqString)
print (seqString + "-" + nexcium)

var firstilum = SequenceUtil.next(1, seqString)
print (seqString + "-" + firstiium)
var nextilum = SequenceUtil.next(1, seqString)
print (seqString + "-" + nexttium)

Question

an What is a package?
7
4

SS eee eee ee eee estes

Answer

ae What is a package?

¢
4

A package is a group of classes gathered together either because they execute a
common business task, or because access to the classes must be limited only to the
classes in the package, or both.

SS eee ene ee soe Sse

Question

,- — AGosu class is named Circle. Each instance must have a property for
Pa the circle's radius. This value can be accessed and conditionally
modified by methods in the Circle class and by methods in other classes.
How many elements must you create to implement this?

SS eee eee ee eee estes

Gi

Answer Gi

_- — AGosu class is named Circle. Each instance must have a property for
Pa the circle's radius. This value can be accessed and conditionally
modified by methods in the Circle class and by methods in other classes.
How many elements must you create to implement this?

Three.
1. Aprivate variable named _ radius.
2. Aget method that retrieves the value of _radius.

3. Aset method that sets the value of _radius.

SS eee ene ee soe Sse

Question
The Circle class extends the Oval class and implements the ICurveLine
aan interface.
v7 1. Can Circle override methods from Oval?

2. Can Circle override methods from |CurveLine?

SS eee eee ee eee estes

Gi

Answer Gi

The Circle class extends the Oval class and implements the ICurveLine
7 interface.

? 1. Can Circle override methods from Oval?

2. Can Circle override methods from ICurveLine?

1. Yes

From a keyword standpoint, yes. If Circle implements the ICurveLine interface,
then Circle must implement all the methods of the ICurveLine interface using the
keyword "override". However, because |CurveLine is an interface, the Circle class
is actually just declaring the implementations of the methods. There are no
method implementations in an interface, so there is nothing to "override" from an
OOP standpoint.

See eseeseeseseeseses
Nh

Question

_— — Whatis the purpose of an annotation?

¢
¢
4

SS eee eee ee eee estes

Answer

_- — Whatis the purpose of an annotation?

¢
¢
4

An annotation provides metadata about the element being annotated.

SS eee ene ee soe Sse

Question

,- — Howdoyou calla static method from a class?

¢
¢
4

SS eee eee ee eee estes

Answer Gi

,- — Howdoyou calla static method from a class?
¢

¢
4

You call a static method by referencing the method name from the class. You must
either reference the fully qualified name of the class or import the class using the uses
keyword followed by the reference to the package path.

SS eee ene ee soe Sse

Question G

_- — Why put logic in a Gosu class as opposed to an entity enhancement?

¢
¢
4

SS eee eee ee eee estes

Answer Gi

ae Why put logic in a Gosu class as opposed to an entity enhancement?

¢
4

Logic that is reusable and generic must be in a Gosu class.

Logic that is intrinsically connected with an entity must be inserted into an
Enhancement.

SS eee ene ee soe Sse

review class and its properties

* Describe common Gosu features used for
integration, such as:
+ Logging
+ Exception handling
+ Annotations

+ Sequence utility

i Student exercise

Create a custom class
